creator: kovacs.janos@ofi.hu
text:
defining ErrorLog to use syslog, there is no per-virtualhost facility but only 
global. The error will be logged to syslog, but all virtualhost's error log will 
be logged with the facility defined at the last virtualhost, even using 

ErrorLog syslog:localX (different X for different vhost)


KJ.

FreeBSD 4.10-RELEASE, Apache1.3.29 build from ports, nothing extra module.

This is a design flaw of syslog, which should be better documented. There's just
one syslog connection and the last opener wins...
creator: nd@perlig.de
brian@garagegames.com
text:
Given that a single Apache server can easily host a dozen virtual hosts, I think it would be much more useful to allow per-virtual host syslog ident tags.  Modern syslogd implementations can filter these (they assume that the ident is the program name).  And you don't have to allocate local0-local7, NNTP, and UUCP all to Apache logs just to cover your virtual hosts.

-- 
brian

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text: This doesn't actually strike me as a documentation issue, but a request for a modification of the log-to-syslog behavior. We can, of course, mention this in the docs, but that doesn't address the actual request.
Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.
creator: rbowen@apache.org
covener@gmail.com
text:
I made the doc updates, but after so long it's pretty clear that nobody has interest in extending the built-in (non-piped) syslog support.  Anyone with interest in encouraged to open a bug or reopen this one with a contribution.

I added doc for the limitation of last facility in use taking effect globally.
